page.title: 02Rail and Road-Dorking NE
page.content: Dorking NE has a main line{railway {station}and the{A24 and A25}roads come through our area. Dorking station was partly modernized 3 yrs ago. It is used only by passengers. Every work day morning in the{rush hour}about 2,000 people catch the train. {A Season Ticket}to London for one year{costs Â£777.}A large car park can take cars in which people drive to the station. The separate signal box near the station tells the train driver whether or not the line ahead is clear. Richard works the signals by hand for long hours using{large {numbered levers. At a petrol station, petrol is delivered by tanker three times a week.When it arrives it is stored safely in{3 undergrond tanks.}They do not expect their{sales}to alter much when the M25 is opened.
